Package com.rapidminer.belt.execution

Interface Context

  • public interface Context
    Execution context for arbitrary, concurrent background jobs. The context need not utilize all available processors (see getParallelism()) and may reject jobs once it becomes inactive (see isActive()).
    Author:
    Michael Knopf

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      <T> java.util.List<T> call​(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>> callables)
      Executes the given Callables in parallel, returning their results upon completion.
      int getParallelism()
      Returns the targeted parallelism level of this execution context.
      boolean isActive()
      Returns true if the execution context is active.
      default void requireActive()
      Checks if the context isActive() and throws a ExecutionAbortedException if it is not.
      static Context singleThreaded​(Context context)
      Derives a Context with parallelism level 1 from the given context.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Returns true if the execution context is active. Inactive contexts may reject new jobs.
        Returns:
        true if the execution context is active

      • requireActive

        default void requireActive()
        Checks if the context isActive() and throws a ExecutionAbortedException if it is not.
        Throws:
        ExecutionAbortedException - if the context is not active

      • getParallelism

        int getParallelism()
        Returns the targeted parallelism level of this execution context.
        Returns:
        the targeted parallelism level

      • call

        <T> java.util.List<T> call​(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>> callables)
                    throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Executes the given Callables in parallel, returning their results upon completion.

        If one of the Callables encounters an exception, the context attempts to cancel the other Callables and throws an ExecutionException that wraps the exception. If more than one Callable encounters an exception, only the first observed exception is reported.

        The method blocks until all Callables have completed.

        Note that the cancellation of one of the Callables might not interrupt the execution of other Callables that have already been started. As a consequence, it is recommended that all long-running Callables periodically check for the cancellation of the computation via requireActive().

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the values returned from the callables
        Parameters:
        callables - the Callables to execute in parallel
        Returns:
        a list containing the results of the callables
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if the computation threw an exception
        ExecutionAbortedException - if the execution was stopped before completion
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given list of Callables is or contains null
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - is the execution context is inactive

      • singleThreaded

        static Context singleThreaded​(Context context)
        Derives a Context with parallelism level 1 from the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - the base context
        Returns:
        a context with parallelism level 1
